tool.name: ChiRA map
tool.command:
chira_map.py -b -a '$alignment.aligner' -i '$query' #if str($alignment.aligner) == "bwa": -s '$alignment.stranded' -l1 '$alignment.seed_length1' -l2 '$alignment.seed_length2' -s1 '$alignment.align_score1' -s2 '$alignment.align_score2' -ma1 '$alignment.match1' -mm1 '$alignment.mismatch1' -ma2 '$alignment.match2' -mm2 '$alignment.mismatch2' -go1 '$alignment.gapo1' -ge1 '$alignment.gape1' -go2 '$alignment.gapo2' -ge2 '$alignment.gape2' -h1 '$alignment.nhits1' -h2 '$alignment.nhits2'
#else if str($alignment.aligner) == "clan": -s2 '$alignment.align_score' -co '$alignment.chimeric_overlap' #end if #if str($reference.ref_type) == "single": -f1 '$reference.ref_fasta' #else if str($reference.ref_type) == "split": -f1 '$reference.ref_fasta1' -f2 '$reference.ref_fasta2' #end if -p "\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4}" -o ./

param.name: ref_type
param.label: Single or split reference?
param.help: Use single if you have all the transcripts in single fasta file. Use split, if you split the reference into two such that each chimeric read arm corresponds to one of them

param.name: stranded
param.label: Map reads to
param.option: Reverse compliment of transcript strand only

param.name: seed_length1
param.label: Seed length 1
param.help: Seed length for 1st mapping iteration. bwa-mem parameter -k

param.name: seed_length2
param.label: Seed length 2
param.help: Seed length for 2nd mapping iteration. bwa-mem parameter -k

param.name: align_score1
param.label: Minimum alignmnet score for 1st mapping iteration

param.name: align_score2
param.label: Minimum alignmnet score for 2nd mapping iteration

param.name: gapo1
param.label: Gap opening penalty for 1st mapping iteration

param.name: gape1
param.label: Gap extension penalty for 1st mapping iteration

param.name: gapo2
param.label: Gap opening penalty for 2nd mapping iteration

param.name: gape2
param.label: Gap extension penalty for 2nd mapping iteration

param.name: nhits1
param.label: Maximum number of allowed multi hits per read in 1st iteration

param.name: nhits2
param.label: Maximum number of allowed multi hits per read in 2nd iteration

param.name: align_score
param.label: Minimum length for each fragment
param.help: Minimu length of the read segment that needs to be mapped. clan_search parameter '-l'

param.name: chimeric_overlap
param.label: Maximum number of bases allowed between the chimericsegments of a read

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
This tool handles the mapping of the reads to reference transcriptome. User can choose between the bwa-mem and CLAN alignment tools.
**Inputs**
* A fasta file containing reads * A reference fasta file containing transcript sequences * An optional second reference fasta file, incase if you split your reference into two
**Output**
* BED file containing the alignments * unmapped FASTA file (only for aligner BWA-MEM)
